titles.title: Super GALS! Kotobuki Ran
gals
超GALS! 寿蘭
Super Gals!
Super Gals !
Super Gals! Tre Ragazze alla Moda
Super GALS!
Superpunce
Superklinke

anime.description: Super GALS! Kotobuki Ran focuses on a teenage girl named http://anidb.net/ch3671 [Kotobuki Ran]. Her father, mother, brother, grandfather and grandmother are police officers. However, she doesn`t want to be a policewoman... after all she just want is to have fun as a GAL. Hanging out in Shibuya with her friends, she always get in some kind of funny trouble. Source: AnimeNfo

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: detective
tag.description: A detective is an investigator, generally either a member of a law enforcement agency or as an individual working in the capacity of private investigators, tasked with solving crimes and other mysteries, such as disappearances, by examining and evaluating clues and records in order to solve the mystery; for a crime, this would mean uncovering the criminal`s identity and/or whereabouts. In some police systems, a detective position is achieved by passing a written test after a person completes the requirements for being a police officer; in others, detectives are college graduates who join directly from civilian life without first serving as uniformed officers. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: dancing
tag.description: Dance is when people move their body to music. There are many kinds of dance, like ballet or waltz. Dancing can be done for fun but can be also an art.

tag.name: shoujo
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shoujo, literally meaning "girl", refers to a female audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: delinquent
tag.description: Delinquents - Every school has them, but not all anime with school setting make delinquents a central topic. There are several versions of these delinquents, though some are grounded on a misunderstanding: * The student with a really bad image and attitude, based on his real criminal actions outside of the school and is even feared by teachers. * The primitive "class bully" that pushes around ("clobbers") his classmates for no apparent reason, possibly extorting lunch money. * The student with an sinister complexion or "evil eye", but is actually a "good" student (unfoundedly feared character). * The rebellious student, who does not care for studying, but is otherwise docile. Called a "delinquent" as a joke.

tag.name: trauma
tag.description: Character with emotional or psychological injury, caused by single or multiple events/experiences in the past.

tag.name: charismatic
tag.description:
Charisma is a compelling attractiveness or charm that can inspire devotion in others.
Source: Wiki

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: present
tag.description: Somewhere between past and future.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: absurdist humour
tag.description: Surreal humour, also known as absurdist humour, is a form of humour predicated on deliberate violations of causal reasoning, producing events and behaviours that are obviously illogical. Constructions of surreal humour tend to involve bizarre juxtapositions, non-sequiturs, irrational or absurd situations, and expressions of nonsense. The humour arises from a subversion of audience`s expectations, so that amusement is founded on unpredictability, separate from a logical analysis of the situation. Its appeal stems from the fact that the situation described is exceedingly ridiculous or unlikely. On an analytical level, all jokes contain a certain amount of incongruity, but while regular jokes carry an incongruity that the audience accepts as compatible with expectations, absurd jokes are characterized by a disproportionate amount of it, with the punch line delivering a situation incompatible with the world as we know it and failing to resolve the matter in the audience`s eyes. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: Japan
tag.description: Japan is a sovereign island nation in East Asia. Located in the Pacific Ocean, it lies off the eastern coast of the Asian mainland and stretches from the Sea of Okhotsk in the north to the East China Sea and China in the southwest. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: prostitution
tag.description: Prostitution is the practice or occupation of engaging in sexual activity with someone for payment.

tag.name: multiple couples
tag.description: More than one couple is developed in the anime.

tag.name: first kiss
tag.description: The first kiss plays a role in this anime. Especially for the female cast this can be quite an important moment, so that stealing ones first kiss is serious for them.

tag.name: unrequited love
tag.description: At least one character has a romantic interest in another one, but the feelings are not returned. This is the cornerstone of all love triangles or love polygons.

tag.name: performance
tag.description: The song performance on stage or acting in a theatre is a central part of the character`s life in this anime type.

tag.name: Asia
tag.description: Asia is Earth`s largest and most populous continent, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres and sharing the continental landmass of Eurasia with the continent of Europe. Asia covers an area of 44,579,000 square kilometers, about 30% of Earth`s total land area and 8.7% of the Earth`s total surface area. The continent, which has long been home to the majority of the human population, was the site of many of the first civilizations. Asia is notable for not only its overall large size and population, but also dense and large settlements as well as vast barely populated regions within the continent of 4.4 billion people. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: pornography
tag.description: Anime clearly marked as "Restricted 18" material centring on all variations of adult sex, some of which can be considered as quite perverted. To certain extent, some of the elements can be seen on late night TV animations.

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: romance
tag.description: Romance describes a story that deals with love between two or more characters typically also having an optimistic ending. Romance is also a difficulty encountered when creating a harem.

tag.name: friendship
tag.description: The feeling of trust, kindness, and friendship between a group of high school students for example, is a central theme of this anime.

tag.name: daily life
tag.description: The antics of the protagonists do not take place in some exotic setting or time, but in everyday life. When not "at the job" this means getting up in the morning, making meals, house cleaning, going shopping or out to eat, visiting the bath house or spa, leisure activities in the spare time, etc. The time "on the job" for students is School Life, for others working in their profession. Daily Life is basically a synonym for everything normal, repetitive, and trivial happening to your average person.

tag.name: school life
tag.description: Since a large part of the anime audience still takes part in school life or is visiting college, it is only natural to choose a setting the audience can identify with, be it elementary, middle, or high school. For the older viewers a college setting with more mature real-life problems is appropriate. And since clubs take up so much time in the lives of students, these are obviously also important.

tag.name: the arts
tag.description: The arts represent an outlet of human expression, usually influenced by culture, and driven by human creative impulse. Major constituents of the arts include literature – including poetry, novels and short stories, and epics; performing arts – among them music, dance, and theatre; culinary arts such as baking, chocolatiering, and winemaking; media arts like photography and film, and visual arts – including drawing, painting, and sculpting. Some art forms combine a visual element with performance (e.g. film) and the written word (e.g. comics). From prehistoric cave paintings to modern day films, art serves as a vessel for storytelling and conveying mankind`s relationship with its environment. Source: Wiki

tag.name: enjo-kousai
tag.description: Enjo-kousai means "compensated dating" and is a practice which originated in Japan where older men give money and/or luxury gifts to attractive women for their companionship, and possibly sexual favours. The female participants range from school-age girls to housewives. A common misconception is that enjo-kousai always involves some form of sexual activity.

tag.name: fashion
tag.description: Fashion is a popular aesthetic expression in a certain time and context, especially in clothing, footwear, lifestyle, accessories, makeup, hairstyle and body proportions. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: facial distortion
tag.description: The characters face are exaggerated into a misshape, deformed, and almost warped. Used as comedy element to express extreme mood swings. Differing from "http://anidb.net/t2652 [Super Deformed]", here only the face changes to an extreme degree, not the whole body of the protagonist.

tag.name: flashback
tag.description: A flashback is a moment in which someone remembers events from their past. In fiction, flashbacks are used primarily to give insight into a character`s mind or to reveal information which had been previously kept from the audience. They normally consist essentially of new content; in some cases, they may also consist of short snippets of already displayed content, as in http://anidb.net/ch23266 [Okabe Rintarou]`s flashbacks in http://anidb.net/a7729 [Steins;Gate], but even in these cases the flashbacks are used to look into what the character is thinking. As such, they are different from and should not be confused with recaps, which are old content being shown again for no particular purpose other than padding or reminding the audience of the events up to that point. As a rule of thumb, to qualify as a flashback, the scene must advance the show`s content in some way or form; anything else is just a recap.

tag.name: randomness
tag.description: The anime does not follow a predictable storyline. New, strange, obscure, or otherwise unexpected story elements are introduced at a whim.

tag.name: intact family
tag.description: The main character`s family is a so-called "nuclear family". Wherein both parents are alive and present in his or her life. This is actually relatively rare for anime, where "parental abandonment" is the norm.

tag.name: female protagonist
tag.description: The anime has a female protagonist.

tag.name: jealousy
tag.description: A character is jealous of another character either due to love, or power, or wealth.

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO EPISODE
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to episode tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what episodes they should be assigned to.

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO CHARACTER
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to character tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what characters they should be assigned to.

tag.name: para para
tag.description: Para Para is a synchronized dance that originated in Japan. Unlike most club dancing and rave dancing, there are specific synchronized movements for each song much like line dancing. Para Para is said to have existed since the early 1980s when European countries started selling Italo disco and Euro disco, and in the mid-to late 1970s, new wave and synthpop music in Japan. However, it did not achieve much popularity outside Japan until the late 1990s. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Kotobuki Ran
character.description: She is the titular character of the series and its main protagonist. She is a very strong-willed, athletic, and attractive gal who rules the streets of Shibuya. Although she comes from a long line of police officers, she is ditzy and absent-minded when it comes to school and the only subject she gets good grades on is physical education and her poorest subjects are mathematics and literature and has trouble even solving problems from lower grade levels.

character.name: Yamazaki Miyu
character.description: Miyu is an independent, headstrong, and very kind classmate of Ran and one of her closest friends. She once was the leader of a street gang called the "Resistance", often wreaking mayhem and irritation during middle school and had a rough-mannered and threatening personality that Ran despised. One day, Yamato (by then a rookie cop) saved her from a tough situation, and his dedication to helping with Miyu`s problems made her fall in love with him. Because of that, she left the life of crime and became a much more polite girl after Yamato told her his wish for her to be good and eventually became great friends with Ran.

character.name: Hoshino Aya
character.description: Aya is one of the top students in Ran`s class, but she was secretly doing enjo kousai to earn money (only announced in the first chapter and episode), since her parents were very stringent about her being in number one in academics and wouldn`t let her do any part-time jobs. Ran found out and confronted her about it, making her realize that she was doing the wrong thing (she insists she never "did it" with anybody) and, since then, Aya became good friends with Ran and Miyu. She is a shy but honest and studious individual who enjoys academics while also longing for excitement every now and then, which is thankfully provided by Ran.

character.name: Himejima Towa
character.description: A young woman who runs the Palm Tree Cafe. She is friends with Yamato and the actor who plays Detective Kudoh. She has known Ran since Ran was just a little girl, and they used to play together. Towa was the one of the first gals in Shibuya, and was the number one gal back in the day, before Towa passed the title to Ran.

character.name: Asou Yuuya
character.description: Yuya is also a student at Meisho Daichi High School, and he is known as "#2" or "second place"; (he was the runner-up to Rei, but is friends with him). He develops a crush on Ran, but she is oblivious to the fact. Although he considers Tatsuki as a rival, they are sometimes as close as brothers and is pretty good friends with Aya.

character.name: Otohata Rei
character.description: Rei is a student at Meisho Daichi High School. He is also known as "#1", because he was featured in a magazine as being the coolest and most handsome teenage guy in the area. He rides a motorcycle and is good friends with Yuya. He has a cold and detached demeanour, but seems to act warmly towards Aya and is constantly annoyed by Ran.

character.name: Kuroi Tatsuki
character.description: Tatsuki (known as Tatsukichi to Ran) is a wild and kind student at Machida West High School, and he calls himself "the parapara king of Machida" (also known as "Machida Black", since the "kuro" in his last name means "black"). He is often nicknamed "Monkey Boy" since his personality is very similar to that of a monkey.

character.name: Kuroi Naoki
character.description: Tatsuki`s little brother, who appeared later in the season. He`s a street-smart, outgoing, but good-hearted boy who like his brother, thinks of himself as a ladies man. He used to have a crush on Ran, then Miyu, and then to Sayo, until he found out that Sayo and Masato had been dating ever since the beginning of junior high.

character.name: Honda Mami
character.description: Mami is a rival of Ran, known as the "Queen of Ikebukuro".

character.name: Kudou Harue
character.description: Harue is Mami`s best friend. She was once a member of a "team" called the "Eagles", which was broken up by Miyu (when she was still part of "Resistance"). She once sent in a nasty email about Miyu and her past. Her name means "owl" in Japanese.

character.name: Tsukino Kasumi
character.description: A young girl who comes on the show around the later part of the series. At first, she appears to be in Ran`s fan club. Her dream is to be the number one gal in Shibuya and overthrow Ran.

character.name: Kotobuki Yamato
character.description: Yamato is Ran and Sayo`s older brother (Ran by nine years and Sayo by ten years) and unlike Ran, he has a sensitive and passionate personality that shows through his job as a cop, and is usually on duty at the Shibuya "koban". The only thing that annoys him is when Ran causes trouble in Shibuya and he has to bring her to the police station. His love interest is Ran`s best friend, the much-younger Miyu Yamazaki, whom he first met when he was a rookie cop and when Miyu was a troubled and violent gangster. It was he that helped her to be good, since he was the only one who believed in her.

character.name: Kotobuki Taizou
character.description: Taizo is Ran`s father. He is the local Chief of Detectives. He disapproves of his daughter`s lifestyle. He tries his best to make Ran say that she wants to be a police officer, and often tries various tactics to get her to do various jobs helping the people (like not giving her money). He is also famous for employing a technique called "Taizo`s Giant Swing of Fury" on Ran when he loses patience with her and once on Sayo.

character.name: Kotobuki Kiyoka
character.description: Kiyoka is Ran`s mother. She is also a police officer. It is a running gag throughout the series about her mysterious age, as she appears to be much younger than her husband. She is much more patient with Ran and the entire family in general- she never seems upset by Ran`s choice to be a Gal as is very supportive of her children.

character.name: Kotobuki Sayo
character.description: Sayo is Ran`s younger sister. She dreams of being a detective like the hero of her favorite television show, Detective Kudou of Odaiba Cop. Sayo and her boyfriend Masato often roleplay as conspicuous detectives, drawing the attention of onlookers and inciting frustration from Ran who is bothered by their antics. She is very energetic and enthusiatic about everything she does- however, she is slightly accident prone and often falls face down when she tries to run away or exit in a dramatic fashion. She tends to add the phrase "You bet" (or "datchu") into her statements.

character.name: Iwai Masato
character.description: Sayo`s partner/boyfriend ever since the beginning of junior high. He fell in love with her as "the cute girl who always wore a hat" (she actually wore hats to school because she cut her bangs too short). From then on, they were a steady couple. He`s a bit fun-loving and kind of weird like Sayo and imitates as a junior cop with her, but very just and gallant, especially to Sayo.

episode.title: ハート♥バラバラ→綾と絶交!?
Fresh Start? Broken Heart? Is It Over with Aya?
Heart Barabara: Aya to Zekkou!?
episode.summary: Its exam time and Ran is struggling through them. The bigger problem is top-of-her-class Aya falls several ranks in the scores. She distances herself from Ran and Miyu to get better grades, but what about her Gal life? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: オンナゴコロ♥ドキドキ→赤メッシュ
A Girl`s Feelings! Hearts Reeling! Red Streak or Not, Miyu`s Taken!
Onnagokoro Dokidoki: Aka Mesh
episode.summary: Things get creepy when Miyu receives a weird love letter in her shoe locker. Will Yamato come to Miyu’s rescue? Ran’s back on the case to help her friend! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 天下のギャル♥イケイケ→寿蘭
The World`s Greatest Gal Go, Go Ran Kotobuki!
Tenka no Gal Ikeike: Kotobuki Ran
episode.summary: Ran is not your typical Gal. But what is a Gal? And what are “ironclad rules of being a Gal?” Ran Kotobuki will teach you! Join Ran as she helps spread world peace, all while being a Gal! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: プール♥ワクワク→チューボー刑事!
Gals Rule the Pool! Too Cool! Junior Detectives!
Pool Wakuwaku: Chuubou Deka!
episode.summary: Ran’s got a new swimsuit, so she wants to show it off at the pool! But her day off could have severe consequences when the ’Bukuro Gals try to take over Shibuya. Aya’s after Rei and Yuuya’s after Ran in their fun day at the pool. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: アルアル?♥ナイナイ?→おとこ運?
Have Got? Have Not? Luck with Guys!
Aru Aru? Nai Nai? Otokoun?
episode.summary: The Gals are telling their love fortunes, but the future looks bleak for Ran. But when Ran does find love, is he really the right guy for her? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 渋谷♥ハラハラ→大捜査線
Phone Tag Gets Chilling! Shibuya Is Thrilling! The Great Dragnet
Shibuya Harahara: Daisousasen
episode.summary: Ran is promised 500 yen to right 10 wrongs. Her first right was catching a girl who tried to steal a purse, but will it turn out to be as mundane a theft as it appears? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 想い出♥ボロボロ→沙夜が誘拐?
Memories! Tearful Memories! Sayo`s Been Kidnapped?
Omoide Boroboro: Sayo ga Yuukai?
episode.summary: In Shibuya, Sayo and Masato are protecting the peace from ne’er-do-wells. Under the watchful eye of Yamato, Sayo’s learning what it really means to be a police officer. But when Sayo gets kidnapped, no one in the Kotobuki family really knows what’s going Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ココロ♥チクチク→美由の過去
A Gal`s Heart! A Guilty Heart! Miyu`s Past Catches Up!
Kokoro Chikuchiku: Miyu no Kako
episode.summary: Thugs from an old gang have attacked Miyu and everyone is trying to figure out who the culprit really is. Detective Ran Kotobuki is back on the case to help her ailing friend. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 黒い影♥ヒタヒタ→狙われた美由
A Black Shadow Creeping Up Behind Her! Miyu Is a Target!
Kuroi Kage Hitahita: Nerawareta Miyu
episode.summary: Miyu’s trying to do 100 good deeds to fulfill her wish, but her past might catch up to her and balance out those good deeds. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 裕也♥ソワソワ→ライバル登場!
Second Place Yuya? He`s First Place Nervous! A Rival Appears!
Yuuya Sowasowa: Rival Toujou!
episode.summary: Second Place Yuuya is trying to confess to Ran, but he’s having a little trouble doing so. Then Tatsuki Kuroi appears and challenges Ran’s parapara dancing abilities as things heat up a little in Shibuya. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 超お嬢様♥ブリブリ→寿蘭
Super Debutante! Super Goody-Goody! Ran Kotobuki!
Super Ojou-sama Buriburi: Kotobuki Ran
episode.summary: When Miyu and Aya wish Ran were a little more studious, she’s suddenly and suspiciously acting different. The Junior Detectives are back on the case to find out what happened to Ran! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 真希♥ピカピカ→ギャル1年生!
Meet Maki! The Shiny, New First Year Gal!
Maki Pikapika: Gal 1-nensei!
episode.summary: Country Girl Maki comes to Shibuya to be an apprentice to Ran. But when Maki wants her idol to demonstrate how much of a Gal Ran truly is, will she be able to survive her own Ironclad Rules for Gals? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 約束♥バイバイ→剣道少女
A Promise Kept! Bye-Bye! Kendo Girl!
Yakusoku Bye-Bye: Kendou Shoujo
episode.summary: When Ran and Kendo Club member Shiori have to do a makeup class, they decide to hang out in Shibuya afterwards. But all Shiori wants is to dress like a girl, and Gal extraordinaire Ran is there to help. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 渋谷横断♥チキチキ→グランプリ
Crisscrossing Shibuya! Fun Fun! It`s a Grand Prix!
Shibuya Oudan Shikichiki: Grand Prix
episode.summary: Yuuya’s a little down over being second place, but when Ran calls him up, all his worries seem to disappear. Things get complicated as Ran decides to hold a contest to decide who will become her boyfriend! What’ll become of Yuuya? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: お台場♥バチバチ→大決戦!
Odaiba Excitement! Crackling Action! The Great Final Battle!
Odaiba Bachibachi: Daikessen!
episode.summary: Odaiba! It’s vacation time for Ran and her friends, and this time Ran is playing Aya’s wingman in the quest for Rei’s love. But when Ran gets separated from the rest of the group, she finds herself accepting a challenge from Mami. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 木洩れ陽♥キラキラ→恋愛記念日
Dappled Sunlight! Sparkling Away! A Romantic Anniversary!
Komorebi Kirakira: Ren`ai Kinenbi
episode.summary: Two years ago, Miyu was a troublemaker in a gang and the school doesn’t know what to do. But when Ran gets caught bringing in snacks and music to school, the teachers coerce her into rehabilitating Miyu. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: リベンジ♥メラメラ→スノボバトル!
Cold Revenge? It`s Burning Hot! Snowboard Battle!
Revenge Meramera: Snowbo Battle
episode.summary: When Ran wins a snowboard in a lottery, she’s taking everyone snowboarding! But in the summer? However, Yuuya might gain a leg up over Tatsukichi in the competition for Ran. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 恋ゴコロ♥ユラユラ→綾が告白!?
Feelings of Love! Start Wavering: Aya Confesses?
Koigokoro Yurayura: Aya ga Kokuhaku!?
episode.summary: When Miyu brings in a romance personality test, Aya gets worried about her results. Ran and her friends spur Aya on to confess her true love to Rei. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 太陽♥サンサン→夏オンナ!
The Sun, Sun, Sun Summer Girl!
Taiyou Sansan: Natsu Onna
episode.summary: Ran’s broke again, so Yamato suggests she gets a job. But he gets a shock when he finds Ran when at the beach while he’s trying to relax with Miyu. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: マミリン♥メロメロ→初恋の人
Dreamy-Eyed Mami! Her First Love!
Mami Rin Meromero: Hatsukoi no Hito
episode.summary: Mami’s broken up with her boyfriend, but her first love is coming to Japan. To top it all off, he wants to go to Shibuya! What’ll happens when Ran shows up? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 必勝♥ゴーゴー→体育祭
It`s Certain Victory! Go! Go! Sports Fest
Hisshou Go Go: Taiikusai
episode.summary: Summer break is over, but Ran’s neglected her summer homework. However, if she wins the sports festival for her class, Mr. Nakanishi will look the other way on her homework. Can Ran pull it off? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 学祭♥パラパラ→明匠クイーン
High School Culture Fest! Para-Para Meisho Queen!
Gakusai Parapara: Meishou Queen
episode.summary: It’s Meisho’s culture festival and the Gals got tickets from Rei. Yamato’s hired the Junior Detectives to make sure no cute Meisho guys take away Miyu, Aya and Rei are still working out their relationship, and Ran and Mami clash for Meisho Queen. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: はがせ♥ベリベリ→教師のメッキ
Tear It Off! Rip, Rip! Teacher`s Gold Leaf Exterior!
Hagase Beriberi: Kyoushi no Mekki
episode.summary: Gunjo’s sore over losing the Sports Festival and he’s taking out his frustrations on class captain, Takezawa. He’s also got it out for Ran over winning the Festival. But it’s certain that Ran won’t stand for this kind of injustice. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 町田へ♥サル去る→タツキチ失恋!?
Off to Machida! The Monkey Leaves! Tatsukichi Gets Dumped?!
Machida e Saru Saru: Tatsukichi Shitsuren!?
episode.summary: The Gals are telling fortunes again and today happens to be Ran’s luckiest day of the year. But the next day, Ran’s gushing over her luck and tries the fortune game again only to find that her unluckiest days are ahead. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 大和♥マジマジ→プロポーズ!?
Yamato`s Dead Serious! Yamato Proposes?!
Yamato Majimaji: Propose!?
episode.summary: The Gals are out looking for jobs again, but they’re being turned down for their looks. When they do find a job at a pastry shop, they have to sell 3,000 Gal pastries by the end of the day. With the help of Rei and Yuuya, it could happen! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 超刑事♥バリバリ→寿蘭
Hard-Working Super Cop, Ran Kotobuki!
Super Cop Baribari: Kotobuki Ran
episode.summary: When Ran wins a sleep learning pillow in a raffle, she accidentally brainwashes herself into wanting to become a police officer. But what will happen of Ran’s normal Gal life? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ブラザー♥キチキチ→ナオキチ見参!
Brother! Kichi-Kichi! Naokichi Appears!
Brother Kichikichi: Naokichi Kenzan!
episode.summary: It’s another Tatsuki. He’s an easy-going boy on a skateboard in Shibuya, and he resembles someone... Who’s the guy? Naoki - Tatsuki’s brother! When he falls in love with Ran, it’s a brother-brother ramen battle for her love! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 裕也♥ナクナク→男を語る
Yuya! Crying! Talks About Being a Man
Yuuya Nakunaku: Otoko o Kataru
episode.summary: Naoki falls for Miyu, but what will he do when he discovers she’s in love with Yamato? Then, when Ran loses her wallet, Yuya sets out to find it. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: マミリン♥ラブラブ→裕也にほれる
Mami-rin! Lovey-Dovey! Falls for Yuya!
Mami-rin Love Love: Yuuya ni Horeru
episode.summary: Mami discovers that her boyfriend is cheating and when Yuya shows up to console her - it’s pure love! However, when she finds out Yuya only has eyes for Ran, she challenges Ran to a fight! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ブクロ♥グルグル→エクステの謎
Bukuro! In Circles! Mystery of the Extension!
Bukuro Garugaru: Exte no Nazo
episode.summary: Mami’s got a new hair extension! But what’s this? Mysterious men have shown up to take it away! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ウェルカム♥ウキウキ→開店! パームツリー
Welcome! Exciting! Palm Tree Grand Opening!
Welcome Ukiuki: Kaiten! Palm Tree
episode.summary: Legendary gal idol Towa Himejima returns to Shibuya to open up a new café called Palm Tree! But when someone tries to disturb her business, Ran takes it personally and searches for the criminal. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 蘭ぴょん♥イライラ→新たなライバル!?
Ran-pyon! Irritated! A New Rival?!
Ran-pyon Iraira: Aratana Rival!?
episode.summary: After Miyu’s cell phone goes missing, Ran gets an anonymous call, telling her to stop being a gal or Miyu’s cell phone will be broken! Then suddenly, Aya has her train pass stolen. Who’s behind it all? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: カスミ♥ムカムカ→リベンジ大作戦!
Kasumi! Pissed! The Great Plot for Revenge!
Kasumi Mukamuka: Revenge Daisakusen!
episode.summary: Ran’s got a wannabe rival on the scene - Kasumi Tsukino. When Ran doesn’t take her seriously, Kasumi tries to get even by setting up traps for her in Shibuya. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 綾っぺ♥ウルウル→乙幡病
Aya-ppe - Teary-Eyed - Otohata Syndrome
Aya-ppe Uruuru: Otohata-byou
episode.summary: Aya starts having problems with Otohata and when a new boy named Katase arrives on the scene, she starts to doubt her relationship with Otohata. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 恋愛予報♥モヤモヤ→乙幡のち片瀬!?
Romantic Forecast! Unclear! Otohata Then Katase?!
Ren`ai Yohou Moyamoya: Otohata nochi Katase!?
episode.summary: Aya is caught between the two men in her life - Otohata and Katase. Who will she choose? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 温泉♥ビバビバ→北の湯けむりギャル事件
Hot Spring! Viva Viva! The Gal Incident in the Northern Steam Clouds
Onsen Viva Viva: Kita no Yukemuri Gal Jiken
episode.summary: Maki Komine invites Ran to her family’s hotel. With Sayo, Masato and Naoki in tow, it’s time for some gal fun at the hot spring! But when a big crime is committed, and Ran becomes the prime suspect! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 秘密♥バレバレ→マミリンの危機!
Secret! Revelead! Mami-rin in Danger!
Himitsu Barebare: Mami-rin no Kiki!
episode.summary: When Mami’s big secret is revealed, she gets seriously worried about her relationship with Yuya. Will he still want to be with her? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ココロ♥ジンジン→乙幡の言葉
Heart! Aching! Otohata`s Words
Kokoro Jinjin: Otohata no Kotoba
episode.summary: Naka-teach asks Ran for a weird favor. He wants her to make rounds with him on his night duty at school because he saw a ghost?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 聖夜♥リンリン→恋の非常ベル
Christmas Eve! Jingle-Jingle! Emergency Bell of Love
Seiya Rinrin: Koi no Hijou Bell
episode.summary: It’s Christmas time! Ran and Tatsuki get involved in an incident where their relationship is tested! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 蘭ぴょん♥クラクラ→沙夜になる!?
Ran-pyon! Dizzy! Becomes Sayo?!
Ran-pyon Kurakura: Sayo ni Naru!?
episode.summary: It’s New Year’s Day and Sayo is upset when Ran gets a bigger New Year’s gift than she did, and dreams of being the older sister. When she buys a good luck bag, it switches Sayo and Ran’s personalities! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: Opening
Ending
渋谷戦士♥ナゾナゾ→マルキュームーン
Shibuya Soldier! Mysterious! Maru-Q Moon!
Shibuya Senshi Nazonazo: Maru-Q Moon
episode.summary: When Shibuya is in trouble, Maru-Q Moon comes to rescue! The whole town is talking about her! Who is this hero in disguise? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 泰三♥ノリノリ→警官養成プロジェクト!
Taizo! Enthousiastic! Police Training Project!
Taizou Norinori: Keikan Yousei Project!
episode.summary: Taizo remembers the days when Ran was in elementary school and wanted to become a cop! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 純情♥モジモジ→理恵の恋バナ
Pure Love! Nervous! Rie`s Love Tale
Junjou Mojimoji: Rie no Koibana
episode.summary: Rie secretly admires Junichi Ota who saved her in elementary school when bullies picked on her. Why can’t she express her feelings to him? And why does he seem to be avoiding her? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 殉職♥シクシク→お台場シャーク最後の日!
Killed in the Line of Duty! Weeping! Odaiba Shark`s Final Day!
Junshoku Shikushiku: Odaiba Shark Saigo no Hi!
episode.summary: When Odaiba Cop’s Detective Kudoh dies on duties, Sayo’s not the only one crying. Matsuda, who plays the role of Detective Kudo, can’t seem to find another gig and winds up back in Shibuya where he used to hang out when he was younger... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 恋模様♥イロイロ→バレンタインデー
Signs of Love! various! Valentine`s Day
Koi Moyou Iroiro: Valentine Day
episode.summary: It’s Valentine’s Day! Tatsuki wants chocolate from Ran, but Ran doesn’t seem inclined. Is their relationship over? They’re not the only ones having trouble. Rei seems to be looking at another girl lately… Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 激突♥チュルチュル→ラーメンバトル!
Clash! Slurp! Slurp! Ramen Battle!
Gekitotsu Churuchuru: Ramen Battle!
episode.summary: Is the Kuroi family in serious trouble? A new ramen noodle chain opens up near the Kuroi’s noodle house, and begins spreading vicious rumors about them! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: カスミ♥ポカポカ→憧れのコート
Kasumi! Toasty Warm! Her Dream Coat
Kasumi Pokapoka: Akogare no Coat
episode.summary: Kasumi falls in love with a coat she sees at a store that resembles a coat one of Kasumi’s role models wore. Unfortunately for Kasumi, Ran also has her eye on the coat! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ギャルバトル♥ガンガン→マミリン破局!?
Gal Battle! Fierce! Mami-rin Finished?!
Gal Battle Gangan: Mami-rin Hakyoku!?
episode.summary: When things get rocky for Yuya and Mami, Mami blames it on Ran and challenges her to a final showdown at the Girls’ Festival! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 傷心♥ヒリヒリ→美由の帰る場所
Heartbreak! Painful! Miyu`s Place to Call Home
Shoushin Hirihiri: Miyu no Kaeru Basho
episode.summary: When Miyu should to be studying for finals, she’s got to support her family or else they’ll be evicted! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 恋の疑惑♥ザワザワ→冷たい春風
Misgivings of the Heart! Stirring! Cold Spring Breeze
Koi no Giwaku Zawazawa: Tsumetai Harukaze
episode.summary: Finals have started and if Ran fails even one exam, she’ll repeat the entire first year again! Talk about pressure! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 友情♥ニコニコ→心のIDプレート
Friendship! Smiles! ID Tags of the Heart
Yuujou Nikoniko: Kokoro no ID Plate
episode.summary: Aya keeps hearing rumors about Ran and Rei. Can she find the courage to ask Rei if the rumors are true? What will he say? And what about her friendship with Ran? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: さよなら♥ランラン→渋谷の空は変わりなく
Goodbye! Ran-ran! The Skies of Shibuya Remain Unchanging
Sayonara Ranran: Shibuya no Sora wa Kawarinaku
episode.summary: It’s one year later! What’s happened to all of our favorite gals? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: Production Sketches
